verses.roman:
aiśvarya-jñāna haite kevalā-bhāva--pradhāna
pṛthivīte bhakta nāhi uddhava-samāna

synonyms: aiśvarya-jñāna haite—than transcendental love in opulence; kevalā-bhāva—pure love; pradhāna—more prominent; pṛthivīte—on the surface of the world; bhakta nāhi—there is no devotee; uddhava-samāna—like Uddhava.
translation: "Completely distinct from love of Kṛṣṇa in opulence, pure love of Kṛṣṇa is on the highest level. On the surface of the world there is no devotee greater than Uddhava.
